greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A signed variant of the Motzkin numbers.
comment: Hankel transform is A131713. Binomial transform is A166588.
[a(n+1)] = [1,-1,2,-4,9,...] is the inverse binomial transform of A126120. - _Philippe Deléham_, Nov 29 2009
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..500
formula: G.f. G(x) satisfies (3 x^2 - 2 x^2 - x) G'(x) - (x+1) G(x) + 3 x + 1 = 0, from which follows 3*n*a(n) + (-3-2*n)*a(1+n) + (-3-n)*a(n+2) = 0 as well as Mathar's conjecture. - _Robert Israel_, May 17 2016
E.g.f.: 1 + Integral (exp(-x) * BesselI(1,2*x) / x) dx. - _Ilya Gutkovskiy_, Jun 01 2020
maple: with(PolynomialTools): CoefficientList(convert(taylor((1 + 3*x - sqrt(1 + 2*x - 3*x^2))/2/x, x = 0, 33), polynom), x); # _Taras Goy_, Aug 07 2017
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 + 3*t - Sqrt[1 + 2*t - 3*t^2])/(2 t), {t, 0, 50}], t] (* _G. C. Greubel_, May 17 2016 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Oct 17 2009
